page.title: 01SHIPDHAM
page.content: {Shipdham}is an old village in Mid Norfolk. It got its name originally by the amount of sheep kept here. {Shipdham}is 19 miles from Norwich. There are 10 shops 1 post office, 3 pubs and 3 garages. The Green is in the centre of the village and the sign shows the "drynking of church ales" in the 1800's. The old school is now a printing hall. The park and the school were donated by{Thomas Bullock}and there is still a{Thomas Bullock Trust. The park has many facilities including a recently reformed Scout Troop. The new school was opened in 1982. The village population is rising all the time but at the moment it stands at 2650. Outside the village there is an airfield built in the war but now used as a flying club and an industrial estate.
